text.s: Ikipe y'abagore y'umupira w'amaguru y'igihugu cya Nigeria izakina umukino wa nyuma w'igikombe cy'Afurika cy'abagore nyuma yo gutsinda ikipe y'igihugu cya Cameroon ibitego bitanu kuri kimwe.
After beating Cameroon with a score of 5 to 1, the Nigerian women soccer team qualified for the final game of the Africa Women Soccer Cup.
Iyi kipe ya Nigeria iboneyeho kandi itike yo kuzakina mu mikino ya nyuma y'igikombe cy'isi cy'abagore izabera mu Budage umwaka utaha.
Thus, the Nigerian team qualified for the final championship games for the Women World Cup to be held in Germany next year.
Umukinnyi w'imbere wa Nigeria Perpetua Nkwocha ku nshuro ya kabiri yatsinze ibitego 3 muri rino rushanwa ririmo kubera muri Afurika yepfo.
For a second time, Nigerian forward Perpetua Nkwocha scored 3 goals during the ongoing soccer championship in South Africa.
Helen Ukaonu na Ugochi Oparanozie nibo batsinze ibitego bindi bibiri muri uwo mukino wabahuje n'ikipe ya Cameroon.
Helen Ukaonu and Ugochi Oparanozie marked the two additional goals in the game that opposed them to Cameroon.
Igitego kimwe rukumbi cya Cameroon cyatsinzwe na Jeanette Ngock.
The only goal scored by Cameroon was authored by Jeannette Ngock.
Nigeria izakina n'ikipe izatsinda umukino wa kimwe cya kabiri ugomba guhuza Afurika yepfo na Guinee Equatoriale ifite icyo gikombe.
Nigeria will meet with the winning team of the half final game between South Africa and Equatorial Guinea, the current holder of the title (Cup).
